business.headline: India eyes new export markets, major boost planned for textiles and jewelleryPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.
Can a Rs 10,000 monthly SIP make you a crorepati? Here's the timelineCan Rs 10,000 a month really make you a crorepati? The maths of SIPs shows that with discipline and time, the answer is yes.

These 3 banks offer special FDs with higher interest rates till September 2025For those planning to invest in FDs, three banks are running special schemes with better interest rates valid up to September 2025.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact India's growthThe 50% tariff by the US comes at a time when India has reported strong growth of 6.5% in 2024–25 and has been projected to remain the fastest-growing major economy.

Filing ITR for FY 2024-25? Keep these 6 documents handyKeeping your documents in order is the first step to a smooth filing process. Not having the documents in place not only delays the process but also increases the chance of errors in the return.

Indian crypto platforms boom in grey zone, says Zerodha's Nithin KamathTraders are increasingly drawn to futures and options (F&O) products in digital assets, lured by high leverage and lower tax costs compared to traditional markets.

Trump's 50% tariff shock: How can exporters shield themselvesThe tariff was announced as a response to India's continued trade with Russia, and it now places Indian products at a disadvantage in the American market.

New to ITR filing? Here's how to create your account on the e-filing portalNew taxpayers often wonder how to start their ITR journey, and the answer is simple: create your account on the e-filing portal to access all tax-related services.

Indian leather industry eyes expansion in Russian, African markets amid US tariffsTrade delegations are set to visit Russia and Africa soon, with Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal expected to lead the mission in Russia. Buyer-seller meets are also planned in African countries.

Ganesh Chaturthi 2025: Is stock market open for trading today?The stock market holiday list for 2025 is available on the official BSE (Bombay Stock Exchange) website. Earlier, markets were closed on August 15 for Independence Day.
How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy and its exports?The United States has escalated its trade dispute with India, imposing new tariffs that bring the total rate to 50% on certain goods.

How will Trump's 50% tariff impact Indian economy? Experts weigh inThe discussion centres on the implications of a 50% tariff threatened by Donald Trump on Indian goods. Experts analyse the potential impact on India's economy, particularly labour-intensive sectors such as textiles, leather, gems and jewellery.

Papa John's to return to India with Bengaluru outlet, plans 650 stores by 2035US-based Papa John's will re-enter India this October, opening its first store in Bengaluru and targeting 650 outlets by 2035. The pizza chain, which exited in 2017 due to poor performance, has partnered with Pulsar Capital and UAE's PJP Investments Group as master franchisees.

TCS appoints Amit Kapur to lead new AI and services transformation unitIn a bid to deepen its AI capabilities, TCS has named Amit Kapur as the head of its newly formed AI and services transformation unit, effective September.

No credit history? How lenders are opening doors for new borrowersFor decades, a blank credit history meant a closed door to loans. Now, fintechs and banks are rewriting the rules—using digital footprints and alternative data to bring first-time borrowers into the fold.

PM holds high-level meet on US tariff impact, explores relief for exportersThe PMO on Tuesday held a high-level meeting with senior ministers and officials from the Finance and Commerce Ministries to frame India's response to the US decision to double tariffs on Indian goods to 50% from Wednesday.

New Income Tax Act's password override: Privacy threat or necessary power?India's new tax law brings a digital twist; officials can now override passwords during raids. Supporters say it's just enforcement in the digital age, but privacy advocates worry about unchecked surveillance.
Sensex slumps 849 points, Nifty below 24,750; Tata Steel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 849.37 points to close at 80,786.54, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 255.70 points to end at 24,712.05.

Woman got tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore. Here's how she reduced it to Rs 0Seema found herself staring at a tax notice of Rs 2.58 crore after selling a piece of land in Patna. The confusion arose due to a simple error in her tax return.

Trump's 50% tariff takes effect tomorrow: Who wins, who losesThe United States government has issued a draft notification confirming the step, which will be applied through a supplementary 25% duty on top of existing tariffs.

What India really needs to become 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047IndiaToday.in reached out to leading economists to understand what India must do over the next two decades to achieve its 'Viksit Bharat' vision. Here's what they had to say.
HDFC Bank share crash explained: Did it actually fall over 50%?HDFC Bank's shares appeared to have tanked over 50% compared to the previous close on Dalal Street in early trade.

Switching from UPS to NPS? Here's what employees must knowCentral government employees now have a one-time chance to switch from the Unified Pension Scheme (UPS) to the National Pension System (NPS). But the move comes with strict rules, deadlines, and conditions.

Simplified, new tax rules and forms: What you need to knowThe Income Tax department is working on new rules and forms under the Income-tax Act, 2025, which will be notified by December-end to ensure a smoother, simpler process for taxpayers.

Once 'white gold', cotton turns into burden for India's farmersAt present, cotton cultivation area, production, and productivity are all going down. In just two years, the cotton cultivation area has fallen by 14.8 lakh hectares, while production has dropped by 42.35 lakh bales.

Sensex crashes 900 points: Why is stock market down today?The BSE Sensex showed a negative start as trading commenced today, with most stocks tanking at the opening bell. Sensex and Nifty fell nearly 1% a few minutes after opening for trading.

Sensex, Nifty tank nearly 1% as US tariff fears spook D-Street investorsThe Sensex fell over 500 points, while the Nifty slipped below the psychological 24,900 mark in early trade, mirroring global risk-off cues.

What is the 10-30-50 formula? Edelweiss MF's Radhika Gupta on smart money habitsRadhika Gupta explained that this tug of war between splurging and saving is not new. In fact, she advised a simple rule for different life stages, i.e., the 10-30-50 principle.

Fitch retains its rating for India, sees growth at 6.5%Fitch's rating comes days after S&P Global Ratings lifted its sovereign credit rating on India, citing strong economic growth, marking its first upgrade in 18 years.
Sensex ends 329 points higher, Nifty above 24.950; Infosys gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 329.06 points to close at 81,635.91, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 97.65 points to end at 24,967.75.

Are wedding gifts really tax-free? Here's the answerIn India, weddings are full of joy, rituals and generous gifts. But when the celebrations end, many couples wonder, do these gifts come with hidden tax bills? The answer may surprise you.

PMO to convene big meeting tomorrow as US tariffs set to come into force: SourcesThe Prime Minister's Office will hold a high-level review meeting on August 26 to assess support measures for Indian exporters hit by higher US tariffs. The session, chaired by the PM's Principal Secretary, comes as Washington doubles duties, with Indian goods now facing a steep 50% tariff, raising cost pressures on exporters.

Why hospitals have barred cashless services from Bajaj Allianz policyholdersThe meeting between AHPI's (Association of Healthcare Providers India) will include core committee members and senior representatives from Bajaj Allianz, and is scheduled for August 28.
Zerodha's Nithin Kamath on the one skill AI can't replaceNithin Kamath explained that curiosity should not be confined to a person's own role but should extend to the larger environment around them.

Big PMO meet tomorrow as Trump's 50% tariffs set to come into force: SourcesStarting Wednesday, Indian goods entering the US market will be subject to a 50% tariff after Washington doubled existing duties, heightening cost pressures on exporters.

Common empanelment explained: Why big private hospitals and insurers are at oddsCommon empanelment aims to simplify cashless insurance in India, but hospitals resist over tariffs and operational issues, leaving policyholders' access dependent on achieving fair rates, efficient settlements, and system flexibility.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again after delayed rollout of utilities?With the revised ITR utilities coming out much later than expected, taxpayers and professionals are now questioning whether the government will grant another extension to ease the compliance burden.

Mangal Electrical IPO allotment out: Check your status, possible listing gainsInvestors who applied for the Mangal Electrical IPO can check their allotment status through two official platforms, the BSE website and the IPO registrar, Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Online gaming law: Will users get Dream11, MPL, Winzo wallet cash?The Online Gaming Bill, cleared by both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha this week, bans all forms of online money games. These are defined as games where players deposit money, directly or indirectly, with the hope of winning cash rewards.

Infosys, TCS, Wipro rally: Why are IT stocks rising today?Analysts said the rally reflects expectations that lower US interest rates will make emerging markets, including India, more attractive to foreign investors, supporting inflows into the sector.

entertainment.headline: KBC 17: Bihar contestant breaks down before Big B, recalls family strugglesIn the latest episode of 'Kaun Banega Crorepati 17', a contestant from Bihar broke down in front of host Amitabh Bachchan. The contestant recalled his family struggles and spoke about the loss of his parents.

Singer Lil Nas X's 1st statement on arrest over cop assault, walking naked chargesSinger Lil Nas X has addressed fans after his arrest in Los Angeles, confirming he is safe. The rapper faces serious felony charges amid disputes over alleged drug use.

Malayalam actor Rajesh Keshav on ventilator support after cardiac arrest in KochiVeteran Malayalam anchor and actor Rajesh Keshav is on ventilator support after suffering a cardiac arrest during a live event in Kochi. Doctors performed an emergency angioplasty, but his condition remains critical with suspected mild brain damage.

Singer Suchitra accuses fiance of abuse: He kicked me, usurped my home, moneySinger Suchitra, in an Instagram video, claimed that she was duped by her lawyer, fiance Shunmugaraj. She claimed to have faced domestic abuse and accused him of usurping her Chennai home.

Pooja Bhatt slams Mumbai's pothole-ridden roads, calls out civic apathyPooja Bhatt criticised the worsening state of Mumbai's roads, especially in Bandra, slamming civic apathy and questioning prolonged repair work that has left potholes untouched.

Half CA 2 Review: Ahsaas's show captures exam stress but misses fresh sparkRelease Date:Wed Aug 27, 2025Half CA 2 review: Ahsaas Channa's series returns with strong performances and heartfelt moments, though its familiar plot makes it a predictable watch.

Neha Dhupia-Angad Bedi go on their first honeymoon after 8 years of marriage. PicsNeha Dhupia and Angad Bedi finally went on their first honeymoon after eight years of marriage, celebrating her birthday with a Mediterranean getaway. The actor shared stunning photos from the trip, calling it a celebration of love, family, and new beginnings.

Rahul Vaidya reacts to Virat Kohli row, says don't care about fragile relationsSinger Rahul Vaidya recently made history as he became the first artiste to perform live at the Lalbaugcha Raja Ganpati celebrations. He spoke about Maharashtrian festivities, singing regional songs, the controversy with Virat Kohli and more, in an exclusive interview with IndiaToday.in.

Shehbaz Badesha shuts down rumours of being in Bigg Boss 19 secret roomActor Shehnaaz Gill's brother, Shehbaz Badesha, clarified in a recent video that he is not locked inside the secret room in 'Bigg Boss 19'. His clarification came after an image surfaced on social media showing Badesha seated in an undisclosed location.

BTS' Jimin dating Song Da-eun? Actor posts surprise video. WatchKorean actor Song Da-eun has posted a video that has once again sparked rumours of a relationship with BTS's Jimin. The pair have been speculated to be romantically involved since 2022, although neither has confirmed the rumours.

Hrithik Roshan rents luxury property in Mumbai's Juhu to girlfriend Saba AzadActor Hrithik Roshan has rented his sea-facing luxury property in Juhu to his girlfriend, Saba Azad, for Rs 75,000 monthly rent. The rental agreement also includes a security deposit of Rs 1.2 lakh.

Masks on: Vijay Deverakonda, Rashmika Mandanna return to Hyderabad after US tripActors Vijay Deverakonda and Rashmika Mandanna were seen at the Hyderabad airport on Wednesday after they returned from the US. The duo attended the India Day Parade and several other events in the US.

LIK first punch: Love meets evolutionship in Pradeep Ranganathan's 2040 storyWritten and directed by Vignesh Shivan, 'LIK' aka 'Love Insurance Kompany' stars Pradeep Ranganathan and Krithi Shetty in a rom-com set in the year 2040. The 'First Punch' teaser also revealed that the film is scheduled to release in theatres this Diwali.

Bigg Boss 19 episode 3: 7 contestants nominated, Tanya-Ashnoor's clash escalatesThe first nomination of 'Bigg Boss 19' took place on Tuesday, with Farrhana Bhatt observing the process from the secret room. Neelam Giri, Tanya Mittal, Abhishek Bajaj and Gaurav Khanna are some of the nominated contestants. Meanwhile, Tanya and Ashnoor Kaur clashed over house duties.

Tanya Mittal in Bigg Boss 19 is annoying, entitled, but absolute TV goldLove her or hate her, Tanya Mittal is already the talking point of 'Bigg Boss 19'. From demanding to be called "Ma'am" and bragging about royal security to throwing around unsolicited knowledge, the self-proclaimed queen has become Miss Pick Me of the season.

Taylor Swift-Travis Kelce engaged: Selena Gomez, Gigi Hadid and celebs send loveSinger Taylor Swift announced her engagement to boyfriend Travis Kelce on August 26. Several stars congratulated the duo and sent their love.

Vash Level 2 review: Krishnadev Yagnik's sequel is raw, chaotic and unsettlingRelease Date:Wed Aug 27, 2025Vash Level 2, the sequel to the 2023 Gujarati hit, dives into a darker, chaotic horror narrative with themes of innocence corrupted
 The film offers intense visuals and performances but struggles with pacing in its latter half

SRK helped me with lip-sync, sat on floor with spot boys: Actor Preeti JhangianiActor Preeti Jhangiani recalled how Shah Rukh Khan's humility and support on the sets of 'Mohabbatein' had a lasting impact on her. She shared that SRK never behaved like a superstar and even helped her overcome struggles during the song 'Soni Soni'.

Vicky Kaushal removes shoes at airport as fan gifts Sambhaji Maharaj idol. WatchActor Vicky Kaushal's recent gesture of removing his shoes after a fan gifted him a Chhatrapati Sambhaji Maharaj idol has surfaced online. The clip has left fans impressed, with many praising his respectful move in the comments.

general news.headline: 34 dead as rain pounds J&K, Jhelum over danger mark, landslide hits Vaishno Devi Yatra UpdatesA landslide triggered by heavy rain claimed 34 lives and left several others injured along the Mata Vaishno Devi Yatra track in Katra. The torrential rain has triggered widespread disruption across the region.

Twist in Noida dowry case, victim's sister-in-law accuses Nikki's family of harassmentNikki Bhati's sister-in-law, Meenakshi, has alleged that she was harassed and assaulted over dowry demands by the victim's family, further claiming that Nikki herself also mistreated her.

'7 jets were shot down': Trump doubles down on India-Pak truce mediation claimThe US President said he pressured Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi to ease tensions with Pakistan, warning of steep tariffs if the conflict escalated. Trump claimed his blunt warning prompted quick action from New Delhi.

Centre clears India's CWG 2030 bid, grant-in-aid sanction for GujaratThe Union Cabinet has approved India's bid to host the 2030 Commonwealth Games in Ahmedabad. This move aims to boost the country's sports profile and support its Olympic hosting ambitions.

In tariff war with Trump, Modi seizes opportunity to reconnect with farmers, MSMEsTrump's 50% tariffs threaten India's farmers and MSMEs, but Modi's defiant reforms and rhetoric aim to shield them, turning a trade war into political redemption for rural India.

Flood fury in India, China, Pakistan: Here's why it's raining so muchIndia, Pakistan, and China have witnessed massive landslides due to heavy rainfall. Urbanisation, industrialisation, and deforestation have escalated climate change, leading to changes in morning patterns.

India eyes new markets amid US tariffs, aims to boost textile, jewellery exportsPlans are being drawn up to explore new markets, increase outreach, and give special attention to sectors such as textiles and gems and jewellery, which are likely to be among the hardest hit by the tariff.

A struggling California teen asked ChatGPT for help. It showed him how to dieA California family filed a lawsuit against OpenAI, alleging that ChatGPT was to blame for their 16-year-old son's suicide. The lawsuit alleges that the chatbot acted as a "suicide coach" for their son and provided him with a "step-by-step playbook" on how to kill himself.

Taylor Swift's engagement ring: Co-designed with love, by Travis KelceTravis Kelce collaborated closely with Kindred Lubeck of Artifex Fine Jewelry to co-design the sparkling symbol of love for Taylor Swift.

J&K's Udhampur logs 629 mm rain, breaks all-time 24-hour record; Jammu sees 296 mmUdhampur smashed its all-time rainfall record with 629.4 mm in 24 hours, while Jammu logged its heaviest downpour since 1973 at 296 mm, triggering deadly landslides, flash floods and large-scale damage.

Did Trump just call American economy dead?After declaring both the Indian and Russian economies dead, US President Trump said the US economy was "dead" too. That was before he made it the "hottest" under his leadership. The US economy has been the world's largest since the 19th century.

Rishabh Agarwal joined Meta with millions in salary, leaves in just 5 monthsMeta's ambitious Superintelligence Lab is already facing turbulence as top AI scientists are resigning. The high-profile exits include AI researcher Rishabh Agarwal, who has announced his exit just five months after joining on a million-dollar package.

From demanding to be called "Ma'am" and bragging about royal security to throwing around unsolicited knowledge, the self-proclaimed queen has become Miss Pick Me of the season.

UP cop returns home for break, sets wife ablaze over dowry and flees, arrestedThe woman, who is a trained nurse, sustained severe burn injuries and has been referred to a hospital in Delhi due to the critical nature of her condition.

Khalistani Pannun bats for Punjab-origin trucker who killed 3 in USKhalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is now defending Punjab-origin truck driver Harjinder Singh, who killed three people in Florida after making an illegal U-turn and working in the US illegally. Singh faces three counts of vehicular homicide.

Watch: Taylor Swift's engagement news interrupts Jannik Sinner's US Open matchTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce announced their engagement, exciting fans worldwide. US Open commentators paused their broadcast during Jannik Sinner's first-round match on Tuesday to celebrate the news.

Who's King Prithu who destroyed Nalanda-raider Khilji, made him retire?The Himanta Biswa Sarma-led Assam government's decision to name Guwahati's GNB Flyover 'Maharaj Prithu Flyover' has revived the heroic tales of King Prithu, the 13th-century raja of Kamrupa. When Khilji, after attacking Nalanda and invading Bengal, was marching through Kamrupa with 12,000 cavalry and 20,000 infantry fighters, Raja Prithu led a multi-community force and decimated Khilji's army.

Speaks against Allah, Islam: Jamiat warns Urdu Academy on hosting Javed AkhtarThe West Bengal Urdu Academy's decision to invite poet-lyricist Javed Akhtar as chief guest for a Kolkata mushaira has triggered protests from two Muslim groups. The Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind and the Wahyahin Foundation have claimed that Akhtar has repeatedly "spoken against religion and God" and demand the invitation be withdrawn.

Rajasthan man files case against Hyundai, Deepika Padukone, SRK over defective carKirti Singh, in his complaint, alleged that the dealership assured him the car was trouble-free, promising to take responsibility in case of any defect. However, soon after purchase, the car started showing serious technical faults.

Video: Jannik Sinner, Aryna Sabalenka chat with children at US Open lemonade standVideos shared on the tournament's official social media handles went viral, documenting players' wholesome conversations with the children.

We taught AI to optimise - not to care. And that should scare usAI doesn't understand ethics but it understands patterns. We like to call these systems "intelligent," but they're not. At least not in any human sense. They don't know what's fair. They don't care what's just. They don't wrestle with ambiguity. They don't understand nuance.

Somebody isn't happy with you: Fiji PM to PM Modi as Trump tariffs kick inThe South Pacific nation's Prime Minister reached New Delhi on Sunday for a three-day visit aimed at strengthening Fiji's partnership with India across sectors including maritime security, trade, and health.

No chance for India to win T20 World Cup 2026: Kris SrikkanthFormer India selector Kris Srikkanth has said that with the current squad, India will not be able to win the T20 World Cup in 2026. He has criticised certain selection calls in the squad for the upcoming Asia Cup 2025 as well.

Bat felt wider: Mark Wood recalls his toughest battles vs Rohit, Kohli, PantEngland pacer Mark Wood opened up on his toughest Indian opponents, recalling why Rohit Sharma's short-ball game, Virat Kohli's fierce competitiveness, and Rishabh Pant's unpredictability made them three of the most difficult batters he has ever faced.

From Mohali to national stage: Six Punjab FC stars earn India call-upsRoundglass and Punjab FC's youth-focused approach shone as six players earned national call-ups. Nikhil Prabhu and Muhammed Uvais were selected for India's CAFA Nations Cup 2025.

Pardeep Narwal's legacy to be honoured by PKL ahead of Season 12 openerThe Pro Kabbaddi League will honour the legacy of Pardeep Narwal ahead of the season 12 opener on August 29. Pardeep retired from kabaddi in June of this year after not getting picked up by any team during the auction.

The Polish star, a devoted fan of the American singer, wished the couple the best while speaking to reporters in New York.

CSK pays heartfelt tribute to 'thirupurra sundaran' R Ashwin after IPL retirementR Ashwin announced his retirement from the Indian Premier League, ending an illustrious stint with Chennai Super Kings. The five-time champions paid a rich tribute to the off-spinner.

Ashwin retires from IPL: Top moments of spin great's Indian Premier League careerRavichandran Ashwin bid farewell to the Indian Premier League after an illustrious career spanning 221 matches and 187 wickets. He won back-to-back IPL titles with Chennai Super Kings in 2010 and 2011 and captained Punjab Kings in 2018, leading them to six victories.

MS Dhoni's shocking leave in the 2019 World Cup recalled by FergusonNew Zealand fast bowler Lockie Ferguson has revealed he was 'surprised' to see MS Dhoni leave deliveries during the 2019 World Cup semi-final against India at Old Trafford.

Michael Clarke grateful after skin cancer removed in fresh health scareFormer Australia captain Michael Clarke has revealed that he has undergone another surgery to remove skin cancer, urging fans to prioritise health check-ups and stay vigilant about sun safety.

Pressure and Promise: Bengaluru Bulls coach Ramesh lays out bold PKL 12 visionBengaluru Bulls hit the reset button ahead of Pro Kabaddi League Season 12, with new coach BC Ramesh taking charge after Randhir Singh Sehrawat's exit. Ramesh opens up on pressure, strategy, and building a balanced squad.

R Ashwin retires from IPL amid trade rumours, sets sight on overseas leaguesIndia spinner Ravichandran Ashwin announced his retirement from the Indian Premier League on Wednesday, August 27. Ashwin announced his retirement via a post on his social media accounts.

Vijay Shankar to join Hanuma Vihari at Tripura, set to leave Tamil NaduIndia all-rounder Vijay Shankar is set to turn out for Tripura in the upcoming domestic season after securing a No Objection Certificate (NOC) from the Tamil Nadu Cricket Association. The 33-year-old's move comes shortly after former India batter Hanuma Vihari also signed up with the North-Eastern side.

Gauff survives Tomljanovic scare, Osaka cruises to second roundCoco Gauff survived a tough first-round match against Ajla Tomljanovic at the US Open. Naomi Osaka impressed with a commanding straight sets win, signalling strong form ahead.

Naveen Kumar's big homecoming: Haryana Steelers raider on a mission to regain magicA motivated and excited Naveen Kumar is eager to find his past best as the star raider returns home to join the Haryana Steelers ahead of the Pro Kabaddi League season 12. Naveen talked about his goals for the new campaign, including facing his former side Dabang Delhi and more.

Thrown out of F1, Sergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas make comeback with CadillacSergio Perez and Valtteri Bottas, who were thrown out of Red Bull and Mercedes respectively, are set to make their Formula 1 return in 2026. Cadillac, the new team in the paddock have signed the duo as their drivers.

Indian football federation faces FIFA ban threat once again: ReportThe All India Football Federation (AIFF) reportedly risks suspension if it does not have its constitution ratified by 30 October, according to a letter from FIFA and the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) sent on Tuesday. Such a suspension would reportedly prevent India's national teams and clubs from competing in international tournaments.

Venus Williams to compete in women's doubles with 2021 finalist Leylah FernandezVenus Williams will be playing women's doubles with Leylah Fernandez after receiving a wild-card entry from the US Tennis Association. The development comes a day after her singles match, where she put up a valiant fight against Karolina Muchova.

Afghanistan's tape-ball dreams: Blossoming in alleys, yearning for respectIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Afghanistan Tapeball Cricket president Sheer Rahman Khater explained how tape-ball cricket has been the grassroots heartbeat of South Asian cricket, shaping legends from Pakistan and powering Afghanistan's rise with fearless batters and fiery pacers.

Playing on rank-turners for WTC points at home backfired on India: PujaraCheteshwar Pujara has cautioned against preparing rank turners, saying they have hurt both India's batting and the quality of Test cricket. He urged India to focus on sporting pitches that produce balanced contests lasting into the fourth and fifth days.

Healthy again, Jannik Sinner breezes into 2nd round, equals Italian recordJannik Sinner began his US Open title defence with a dominant straight-sets win over Vit Kopriva on August 26. The Italian World No. 1 extended his winning run in hard-court Grand Slams to 22 matches.

Pulwama hosts its first-ever day-night cricket match, draws thousands of spectatorsThe Royal Premier League kicked off in Pulwama as Royal Goodwill defeated Sultan Springs Baramulla in a thrilling opener, with thousands of fans celebrating the start of Kashmir's biggest local cricketing platform.

Sanju Samson in red-hot form ahead of Asia Cup, shines as opener in Kerala leagueSanju Samson continues his stellar form as the Asia Cup approaches. He scored a blistering 89 in 46 balls to help the Kochi-based franchise post a fighting first-innings total.

Lucas Vazquez signs for Bayer Leverkusen till 2027 after Real Madrid goodbyeLucas Vazquez's switch from Real Madrid to Bayer Leverkusen marks the end of an era for the veteran defender. The move opens a fresh Bundesliga chapter, with Xabi Alonso's legacy still looming large at the German club.

US Open: Iga Swiatek brushes aside Emiliana Arango to reach second roundIga Swiatek made the perfect start to her US Open campaign as she made light work of Emiliana Arango in the first round on Tuesday, August 26. Swiatek needed just an hour to get past the Colombian Arango at the Arthur Ashe stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
